comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

pull_request.body:
# Creating the pull request

> Please include a summary of the change and which issue is fixed\
> If the related issue does not exist in our repository, please create it before making pull request\
> It is highly recommended to use our [Web Reporting Tool](https://kb.adguard.com/en/technical-support/reporting-tool) instead of creating an issue on GitHub directly\
> Please note, that we verify every pull request manually, so it may take time to apply it

## Prerequisites

### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms

- [ ] This is not an ad/bug report;
- [x] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [x] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure.

## What problem does the pull request fix?

### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section

- [x] Missed ads or ad leftovers;
- [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly;
- [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website;
- [ ] Missed analytics or tracker;
- [ ] Social media buttons — share, like, tweet, etc;
- [x] Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc;
- [x] Filters maintenance.

## What issue is being fixed?

Coverage of major social medias' Tor addresses had not been universally applied in Base Filter and Popups Filter, primarily in the case of Reddit whose Tor address is the newest created.

### Enter the issue address

N/A

### Add your comment and screenshots

#### If possible, a screenshot of a page or application should not be cropped too much. Otherwise, it is not always clear where the element is located

1. Your comment

Although the `[$` syntax was new to me, I went through the 3 most important files in the repo to modify their existing entries to cover the Tor addresses.

2. Screenshots

<details><summary>Reddit Onion site ad currently not blocked by big adblocker lists:</summary>

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22780683/221485786-ea2f8d57-7464-4662-8628-3dd414901c9f.png)

</details>

### Terms

- [x] By submitting this issue, I agree that pull request does not contain private info and all conditions are met

This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

comment.body:
It seems that this website is geo-locked and I cannot open it even with VPN.

@zyxel Could you please add this rule:
```adblock
@@||uprot.net^$generichide
```
to user rules and check if issue still occurs?

If still there will be an anti-adblock notice, then could you please open filtering log in AdGuard app, clear filtering log, reproduce issue and make a screenshot with all blocked requests?

comment.body:
I was able to reproduce it.
Fixed, filters update should be available in 1-2 hours.

<hr>

@DandelionSprout Could you please take a look?
The same issue is caused by this rule:
```adblock
$removeparam=tduid,domain=~redir.tradedoubler.com
```
from `Legitimate URL Shortener` filter list.
Adding `~redirects.tradedoubler.com` should fixes it.

Recently, SKEIDs combined identical rules and somewhere with the help of path was narrowed down and had to ditch it, however.

> https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/pull/137586#discussion_r1051386265

So it would be useful to document how the path affects decimal domains.

It may also be about backward compatibility so that the simpler filter does not deactivate in a non-updated application/add-on.

pull_request.title: Added coverage for the Tor domains of Reddit, Twitter, and Facebook
pull_request.body:
# Creating the pull request

> Please include a summary of the change and which issue is fixed\
> If the related issue does not exist in our repository, please create it before making pull request\
> It is highly recommended to use our [Web Reporting Tool](https://kb.adguard.com/en/technical-support/reporting-tool) instead of creating an issue on GitHub directly\
> Please note, that we verify every pull request manually, so it may take time to apply it

## Prerequisites

### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms

- [ ] This is not an ad/bug report;
- [x] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [x] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure.

## What problem does the pull request fix?

### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section

- [x] Missed ads or ad leftovers;
- [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly;
- [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website;
- [ ] Missed analytics or tracker;
- [ ] Social media buttons — share, like, tweet, etc;
- [x] Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc;
- [x] Filters maintenance.

## What issue is being fixed?

Coverage of major social medias' Tor addresses had not been universally applied in Base Filter and Popups Filter, primarily in the case of Reddit whose Tor address is the newest created.

### Enter the issue address

N/A

### Add your comment and screenshots

#### If possible, a screenshot of a page or application should not be cropped too much. Otherwise, it is not always clear where the element is located

1. Your comment

Although the `[$` syntax was new to me, I went through the 3 most important files in the repo to modify their existing entries to cover the Tor addresses.

2. Screenshots

<details><summary>Reddit Onion site ad currently not blocked by big adblocker lists:</summary>

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22780683/221485786-ea2f8d57-7464-4662-8628-3dd414901c9f.png)

</details>

### Terms

- [x] By submitting this issue, I agree that pull request does not contain private info and all conditions are met

Coverage of major social medias' Tor addresses had not been universally applied in Base Filter and Popups Filter, primarily in the case of Reddit whose Tor address is the newest created.

### Enter the issue address

N/A

#### If possible, a screenshot of a page or application should not be cropped too much. Otherwise, it is not always clear where the element is located

1. Your comment

Although the `[$` syntax was new to me, I went through the 3 most important files in the repo to modify their existing entries to cover the Tor addresses.

issue.body:
# Creating the pull request

> Please include a summary of the change and which issue is fixed\
> If the related issue does not exist in our repository, please create it before making pull request\
> It is highly recommended to use our [Web Reporting Tool](https://kb.adguard.com/en/technical-support/reporting-tool) instead of creating an issue on GitHub directly\
> Please note, that we verify every pull request manually, so it may take time to apply it

## Prerequisites

### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms

- [ ] This is not an ad/bug report;
- [x] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [x] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure.

## What problem does the pull request fix?

### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section

- [x] Missed ads or ad leftovers;
- [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly;
- [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website;
- [ ] Missed analytics or tracker;
- [ ] Social media buttons — share, like, tweet, etc;
- [x] Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc;
- [x] Filters maintenance.

## What issue is being fixed?

Coverage of major social medias' Tor addresses had not been universally applied in Base Filter and Popups Filter, primarily in the case of Reddit whose Tor address is the newest created.

### Enter the issue address

N/A

### Add your comment and screenshots

#### If possible, a screenshot of a page or application should not be cropped too much. Otherwise, it is not always clear where the element is located

1. Your comment

Although the `[$` syntax was new to me, I went through the 3 most important files in the repo to modify their existing entries to cover the Tor addresses.

2. Screenshots

<details><summary>Reddit Onion site ad currently not blocked by big adblocker lists:</summary>

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22780683/221485786-ea2f8d57-7464-4662-8628-3dd414901c9f.png)

</details>

### Terms

- [x] By submitting this issue, I agree that pull request does not contain private info and all conditions are met

# Creating the pull request

> Please include a summary of the change and which issue is fixed\
> If the related issue does not exist in our repository, please create it before making pull request\
> It is highly recommended to use our [Web Reporting Tool](https://kb.adguard.com/en/technical-support/reporting-tool) instead of creating an issue on GitHub directly\
> Please note, that we verify every pull request manually, so it may take time to apply it

## Prerequisites

### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms

- [ ] This is not an ad/bug report;
- [x] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [x] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure.

## What problem does the pull request fix?

### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section

- [x] Missed ads or ad leftovers;
- [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly;
- [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website;
- [ ] Missed analytics or tracker;
- [ ] Social media buttons — share, like, tweet, etc;
- [x] Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc;
- [x] Filters maintenance.

## What issue is being fixed?

Coverage of major social medias' Tor addresses had not been universally applied in Base Filter and Popups Filter, primarily in the case of Reddit whose Tor address is the newest created.

### Enter the issue address

N/A

### Add your comment and screenshots

#### If possible, a screenshot of a page or application should not be cropped too much. Otherwise, it is not always clear where the element is located

Although the `[$` syntax was new to me, I went through the 3 most important files in the repo to modify their existing entries to cover the Tor addresses.

comment.body:
Można przykładowo tak:

```adb
archiwumalle.pl#%#//scriptlet("abort-current-inline-script", "jQuery", "ga")
! by mapx-
```

A pod CB/iOS:

```adb
archiwumalle.pl#@#.adplacement
```

(zakładając, że bait nie jest aktualizowany lub ukierunkowany pod filtry obecne też w AdGuard Base - niedostępne dla "ABP"/"AdBlock")

issue.title: Added coverage for the Tor domains of Reddit, Twitter, and Facebook
issue.body:
# Creating the pull request

> Please include a summary of the change and which issue is fixed\
> If the related issue does not exist in our repository, please create it before making pull request\
> It is highly recommended to use our [Web Reporting Tool](https://kb.adguard.com/en/technical-support/reporting-tool) instead of creating an issue on GitHub directly\
> Please note, that we verify every pull request manually, so it may take time to apply it

## Prerequisites

### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms

- [ ] This is not an ad/bug report;
- [x] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [x] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure.

## What problem does the pull request fix?

### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section

- [x] Missed ads or ad leftovers;
- [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly;
- [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website;
- [ ] Missed analytics or tracker;
- [ ] Social media buttons — share, like, tweet, etc;
- [x] Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc;
- [x] Filters maintenance.

## What issue is being fixed?

Coverage of major social medias' Tor addresses had not been universally applied in Base Filter and Popups Filter, primarily in the case of Reddit whose Tor address is the newest created.

### Enter the issue address

N/A

### Add your comment and screenshots

#### If possible, a screenshot of a page or application should not be cropped too much. Otherwise, it is not always clear where the element is located

1. Your comment

Although the `[$` syntax was new to me, I went through the 3 most important files in the repo to modify their existing entries to cover the Tor addresses.

2. Screenshots

<details><summary>Reddit Onion site ad currently not blocked by big adblocker lists:</summary>

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22780683/221485786-ea2f8d57-7464-4662-8628-3dd414901c9f.png)

</details>

### Terms

- [x] By submitting this issue, I agree that pull request does not contain private info and all conditions are met

comment.body:
I see path cover all domains separated by comma:

```adb
[$path=/^\\/$/]deepl.com,translate.google.com##body > *
[$path=/^(/en/translator|\\/)$/]deepl.com,translate.google.com##body > *
```

Also these is applied only on first:
```
deepl.com,[$path=/^\\/$/]translate.google.com##body > *
```

So first was correct:

> `[$path=/marketplace/]facebook.com,facebookwkhpilnemxj7asaniu7vnjjbiltxjqhye3mhbshg7kx5tfyd.onion#$?#div[class][style^="max-width:"]:has(> span > div  a[href^="/ads/about/"]) { display: none !important; }`

issue.title: Added coverage for the Tor domains of Reddit, Twitter, and Facebook
issue.body:
# Creating the pull request

> Please include a summary of the change and which issue is fixed\
> If the related issue does not exist in our repository, please create it before making pull request\
> It is highly recommended to use our [Web Reporting Tool](https://kb.adguard.com/en/technical-support/reporting-tool) instead of creating an issue on GitHub directly\
> Please note, that we verify every pull request manually, so it may take time to apply it

## Prerequisites

### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms

- [ ] This is not an ad/bug report;
- [x] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [x] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure.

## What problem does the pull request fix?

### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section

- [x] Missed ads or ad leftovers;
- [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly;
- [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website;
- [ ] Missed analytics or tracker;
- [ ] Social media buttons — share, like, tweet, etc;
- [x] Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc;
- [x] Filters maintenance.

## What issue is being fixed?

Coverage of major social medias' Tor addresses had not been universally applied in Base Filter and Popups Filter, primarily in the case of Reddit whose Tor address is the newest created.

### Enter the issue address

N/A

### Add your comment and screenshots

#### If possible, a screenshot of a page or application should not be cropped too much. Otherwise, it is not always clear where the element is located

1. Your comment

Although the `[$` syntax was new to me, I went through the 3 most important files in the repo to modify their existing entries to cover the Tor addresses.

2. Screenshots

<details><summary>Reddit Onion site ad currently not blocked by big adblocker lists:</summary>

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22780683/221485786-ea2f8d57-7464-4662-8628-3dd414901c9f.png)

</details>

### Terms

- [x] By submitting this issue, I agree that pull request does not contain private info and all conditions are met

pull_request.title: Added coverage for the Tor domains of Reddit, Twitter, and Facebook
pull_request.body:
# Creating the pull request

> Please include a summary of the change and which issue is fixed\
> If the related issue does not exist in our repository, please create it before making pull request\
> It is highly recommended to use our [Web Reporting Tool](https://kb.adguard.com/en/technical-support/reporting-tool) instead of creating an issue on GitHub directly\
> Please note, that we verify every pull request manually, so it may take time to apply it

## Prerequisites

### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms

- [ ] This is not an ad/bug report;
- [x] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [x] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure.

## What problem does the pull request fix?

### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section

- [x] Missed ads or ad leftovers;
- [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly;
- [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website;
- [ ] Missed analytics or tracker;
- [ ] Social media buttons — share, like, tweet, etc;
- [x] Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc;
- [x] Filters maintenance.

## What issue is being fixed?

Coverage of major social medias' Tor addresses had not been universally applied in Base Filter and Popups Filter, primarily in the case of Reddit whose Tor address is the newest created.

### Enter the issue address

N/A

### Add your comment and screenshots

#### If possible, a screenshot of a page or application should not be cropped too much. Otherwise, it is not always clear where the element is located

1. Your comment

Although the `[$` syntax was new to me, I went through the 3 most important files in the repo to modify their existing entries to cover the Tor addresses.

2. Screenshots

<details><summary>Reddit Onion site ad currently not blocked by big adblocker lists:</summary>

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22780683/221485786-ea2f8d57-7464-4662-8628-3dd414901c9f.png)

</details>

### Terms

- [x] By submitting this issue, I agree that pull request does not contain private info and all conditions are met

pull_request.title: Added coverage for the Tor domains of Reddit, Twitter, and Facebook
pull_request.body:
# Creating the pull request

> Please include a summary of the change and which issue is fixed\
> If the related issue does not exist in our repository, please create it before making pull request\
> It is highly recommended to use our [Web Reporting Tool](https://kb.adguard.com/en/technical-support/reporting-tool) instead of creating an issue on GitHub directly\
> Please note, that we verify every pull request manually, so it may take time to apply it

## Prerequisites

### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms

- [ ] This is not an ad/bug report;
- [x] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [x] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure.

## What problem does the pull request fix?

### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section

- [x] Missed ads or ad leftovers;
- [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly;
- [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website;
- [ ] Missed analytics or tracker;
- [ ] Social media buttons — share, like, tweet, etc;
- [x] Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc;
- [x] Filters maintenance.

## What issue is being fixed?

Coverage of major social medias' Tor addresses had not been universally applied in Base Filter and Popups Filter, primarily in the case of Reddit whose Tor address is the newest created.

### Enter the issue address

N/A

### Add your comment and screenshots

#### If possible, a screenshot of a page or application should not be cropped too much. Otherwise, it is not always clear where the element is located

1. Your comment

Although the `[$` syntax was new to me, I went through the 3 most important files in the repo to modify their existing entries to cover the Tor addresses.

2. Screenshots

<details><summary>Reddit Onion site ad currently not blocked by big adblocker lists:</summary>

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22780683/221485786-ea2f8d57-7464-4662-8628-3dd414901c9f.png)

</details>

### Terms

- [x] By submitting this issue, I agree that pull request does not contain private info and all conditions are met

comment.body:
This issue has been escalated to [AdGuard Extra](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardExtra):
https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardExtra/issues/418

Please wait until it is solved there.

If you’re using AdGuard for Windows, Mac or Android, you’re probably already using AdGuard Extra so you just need to wait until it is updated.

If you’re using AdGuard Browser Extension, we suggest installing AdGuard Extra in addition to it.

* [Install for Chrome, Edge or other Chromium-based browsers](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_chrome_release)
* [Install for Firefox](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_firefox_release)

issue.title: www.olx.ua
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://www.olx.ua/purchase/promote/provider/?ad-id=776758180&bs=olx_pro_listing&product-id=bundle_premium](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.olx.ua%2Fpurchase%2Fpromote%2Fprovider%2F%3Fad-id%3D776758180%26bs%3Dolx_pro_listing%26product-id%3Dbundle_premium) ### Comment > Adguard блокирует оплату на сайте ОЛХ по адресу https://www.olx.ua/uk/purchase/promote/provider/?ad-id=778383481&bs=olx_pro_listing&product-id=pushup_automatic По адресу там есть значек оплата через приват банк, после нажатия на значек должна открыватся платежная страница, но она не открывается, идет бесконечная загрузка страницы. После отключения защиты Adguard, и обновления окна браузера, платежная страница открывается без проблем. > > уточню. После нажатия на значек Приват24 страница должна перейти по адресу > https://www.olx.ua/api/v1/transaction/197338499/redirect > > а потом через секунду переходит по адресу > https://www.liqpay.ua/uk/checkout/privat_pay/checkout_1677079878069945_77747858_VQqwFfJtkJoqsqMUGZ5w > > Но с включенной защитой adguard переход по адресу https://www.olx.ua/api/v1/transaction/197338499/redirect не происходит. ### Screenshots

pull_request.title: Added coverage for the Tor domains of Reddit, Twitter, and Facebook
pull_request.body:
# Creating the pull request

> Please include a summary of the change and which issue is fixed\
> If the related issue does not exist in our repository, please create it before making pull request\
> It is highly recommended to use our [Web Reporting Tool](https://kb.adguard.com/en/technical-support/reporting-tool) instead of creating an issue on GitHub directly\
> Please note, that we verify every pull request manually, so it may take time to apply it

## Prerequisites

### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms

- [ ] This is not an ad/bug report;
- [x] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [x] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure.

## What problem does the pull request fix?

### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section

- [x] Missed ads or ad leftovers;
- [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly;
- [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website;
- [ ] Missed analytics or tracker;
- [ ] Social media buttons — share, like, tweet, etc;
- [x] Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc;
- [x] Filters maintenance.

## What issue is being fixed?

Coverage of major social medias' Tor addresses had not been universally applied in Base Filter and Popups Filter, primarily in the case of Reddit whose Tor address is the newest created.

### Enter the issue address

N/A

### Add your comment and screenshots

#### If possible, a screenshot of a page or application should not be cropped too much. Otherwise, it is not always clear where the element is located

1. Your comment

Although the `[$` syntax was new to me, I went through the 3 most important files in the repo to modify their existing entries to cover the Tor addresses.

2. Screenshots

<details><summary>Reddit Onion site ad currently not blocked by big adblocker lists:</summary>

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22780683/221485786-ea2f8d57-7464-4662-8628-3dd414901c9f.png)

</details>

### Terms

- [x] By submitting this issue, I agree that pull request does not contain private info and all conditions are met

comment.body:
Not reproduced it on my end.
Try to clear browser data, update the filters (wait almost one minute there), open the site.
If that doesn't work, you should re-enable the content blockers in Safari settings (wait about the same time as when you update the filters).

comment.body:
`tduid` parameter is used not only directly on `tradedoubler.com`, but also on destination websites, like for example:
```
https://www.mediaexpert.pl/smartfony-i-zegarki/smartwatche-i-zegarki/smartwatche/smartwatch-samsung-galaxy-watch5-sm-r905fzaaeue-lte-40mm-czarny?tduid=94103d3f9cabc857e20e2f7dc7cd34f4
```

I will change it to:
```adblock
$removeparam=tduid
```
and add:
```adblock
@@||tradedoubler.com^$removeparam=tduid
```
to `allowlist`.

issue.body:

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

comment.body:
It seems that you uses Proton VPN instead of AdGuard's local VPN profile.
You can read [a related wiki document](https://github.com/List-KR/List-KR/wiki/AdGuard-VPN-외-다른-VPN-서비스-사용하기) that will be created to connect another VPN service.
For now, you need to disconnect from any VPN service including Proton VPN unless you use AdGuard VPN service. therefore, please change to VPN mode in AdGuard's Network -> Filtering method.

<details><summary>한국어 - Korean</summary>

AdGuard의 로컬 VPN 프로필 대신에 Proton VPN을 사용하시는 것 같습니다.
또 다른 VPN 서비스에 연결하기 위해 생성될 [관련된 위키 문서](https://github.com/List-KR/List-KR/wiki/AdGuard-VPN-외-다른-VPN-서비스-사용하기)를 읽으실 수 있습니다.
지금으로는, AdGuard VPN 서비스를 사용하시지 않는 이상 Proton VPN을 포함한 VPN 서비스으로부터 연결을 끊으셔야 합니다. 따라서, AdGuard의 네트워크 -> 필터링 방법에서 VPN 모드로 변경해주세요.

</details>

comment.body:
@jellizaveta I think the site owner only whitelisted Brazilian IP, but i tried clear browser cache and check again but not work, i also tried install the Adguard extension, even after that the ads on the bottom of the page continues showing. It's how i sayed previously to get the ads: click one time on "Leitura Vertical"
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/70459964/221637853-a1adbb74-37ed-4a56-ba34-ca4e7d794347.png)
which allows scroll mode and go to the bottom of the page, sometimes the ads will not show, but the ads will appear anytime surely after some F5. The filter Language-specific: AdGuard Spanish/Portuguese already block some ads from mangalivre, but not this ad i showed. https://s.mangalivre.net/$domain=mangalivre.net <- This rule block 100% of the ads i showed you, would be really nice if you guys put in the AdGuard Spanish/Portuguese filter.

Before the filter: 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/70459964/221645299-42cd3436-aaae-4f74-9583-32b4a15d7b9a.png)

After the filter:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/70459964/221645481-f2ed13d7-8fdb-49d4-98db-383862781115.png)

issue.title: www.xda-developers.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://www.xda-developers.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.xda-developers.com) ### Comment Username: @dvd2263 > When I try and go to the website https://www.xda-developers.com in an application or the Chrome browser on my phone I cannot connect. The explanatory screen says that the connection is not secure. even tried adding an exclusion in the VPN app for the website but that made no > difference.
